alert.note: Alert for Upper San Joaquin River; Yosemite NP outside of the valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 7:28PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN MADERA COUNTY THROUGH 800 PM PDT... At 727 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of June Lake. This storm is nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. Localized high rainfall rates could lead to nuisance flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Localized high rainfall rates could lead to nuisance flooding. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Madera County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Upper San Joaquin River; Yosemite NP outside of the valley
